result.execSummary:
The defendant Quentin J Heron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Quentin J Heron is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Quentin J Heron was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.    DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of Extended Supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quentin J Heron

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Quentin J Heron in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Defendant Quentin J Heron in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE); the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS NOT eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program". 

Court orders restitution set at $0. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.   
As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief.

Defendant Quentin J Heron in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Defendant Quentin J Heron in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for sentencing hearing today.  Court is currently in trial and unable to conduct hearing.  Spin court may be available.  Defense requests adjourned date, Court orders hearing adjourned.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt in court, defendant Quentin J Heron not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for sentencing hearing today.  Court is currently in trial and unable to conduct hearng today.  Court orders sentencing adjourned.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 23, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
BOX 694

At the hour of 2:44 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson (#26), brought in a verdict of GUILTY AS TO COUNT 2, which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed. Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict. Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Matter adjourned for sentencing in Branch 35.

Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Case recalled in PM. Appearance remain the same. Final jury instructions placed on the record. Jury in box. Defense and state rest. Court instructed jury. Closing arguments by state and defense. Testimony closed. Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 2:21 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Johnson and Bertschy who were duly sworn for that purpose. Juror question placed on the record and filed.

Defendant Quentin J Heron in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Defendant Quentin J Heron in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial.  Court hears argument regarding defense objection to still photos to be presented to the jury. Court allows photos to be presented. Argument heard as to defense objection to witness testimony.  Sworn: City of Milwaukee Detective, Michael Slomczewski. Court places ruling on the record. Jury panel in box 9:37 am. Exhibit 3 & 1 received and published for the jury. State reads stipulation into the record. Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Detective, Michael Slomczewski. Exhibits 4-21  received and published. Exhibit 1 (DVD) played in open court. Exhibits 22-25 received and published. Exhibit #2 stipulation 1 read in open court by state and received. 
State rests subject to rebuttal. Jury out of box for break. Defense places objection of testimony and moves for dismissal. Court denies defense move for dismissal. Court to hear offer of proof regarding defense witness testimony. Sworn: Detective Kenyatte Wooden of Milwaukee Police Department. Arguments heard. Off record discussion held in chambers. Court places ruling on the record. Jury in box. Sworn for defense: Detective Kenyatte Wooden of Milwaukee Police Department. Exhibits 26-30 received and published. Jury out of box. Court in recess.

Case recalled for the PM. Appearances remain the same. Court holds colloquy on stipulation (Exhibit 2). Jurors in box at 1:55 pm. Voir dire process continued. Panel out of box. Strikes for cause placed on the record.  Additional questions asked of individual jurors. Court holds colloquy on stipulation (Exhibit 3). Jury panel in court. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court instructed jury. Opening statements by state and defense. Court releases the jury for the day at 4:43 pm. Trial to continue at 8:30 am 10-20-2016.

Defendant Quentin J Heron in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Defendant Quentin J Heron in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. Off record discussion held in chambers. Status of off record discussion held on the record. State not ready for trial as to count 1, due to not being able to subpoena a witness, however is ready to proceed with count 2. Defense ready to proceed with trial. Court passes case to allow time for defendant to obtain jury clothes. Case recalled. Appearances remain the same. Parties ready to proceed with trial. State moves to dismiss count 1 without prejudice. Defense moves to dismiss count 1 with prejudice. On, motion of the state, Court DISMISS COUNT 1 WITHOUT PREJUDICE. Discussions of stipulations and motions placed on the record. Court orders exclusion of co-defendant. Court places trial procedures on the record. Court makes witness exclusion order.  At the hour of 11:33 am jury in box. Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 11:35 am. Court gives jury instructions and releases jurors for lunch at 12:01 pm (jurors out of box) and to return at 1:30 pm.
State's Witness List received and filed.
Defendant's Supplemental Motions in Limine received and filed.

Defendant Quentin J Heron in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Defendant Quentin J Heron in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pre-trial. Court held in chambers discussion. Court places status on the record.  Case remains in trial posture. Matter remains scheduled for jury trial for 10-19-2016 9:30 am.

Defendant Quentin J Heron in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Defendant Quentin J Heron in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court conducts final pretrial conference with counsel in chambers off the record, matter continues on the record.  Matter is scheduled for jury trial on 7/18/16 at 9:30am.  Court has several speedy trials set, it is likely this matter will not proceed to trial as scheduled.  Defense requests adjournment of trial date.  Court orders 7/18/16 trial date vacated, new trial date selected.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Quentin J Heron in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Defendant Quentin J Heron in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Quentin J Heron in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Quentin J Heron in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case recalled at the hour of 2:31 pm.  SAME DAY, SAME APPEARANCES.  Arguments continue as to probable cause.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss complaint.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
